text: Scott W. Hahn (born October 28, 1957) is an American Christian theologian and apologist. He was born in Bethel Park, Pennsylvania. Hahn's popular works include Rome Sweet Home and The Lamb's Supper: The Mass as Heaven on Earth. His lectures have been seen through Lighthouse Catholic Media. Hahn is known for his research on Early Christianity during the Apostolic Age and many theoretical works about the early Church Fathers. Hahn teaches at the Franciscan University of Steubenville, a Catholic university in the United States.Franciscan University of Steubenville He has also lectured at the Pontifical College Josephinum in Columbus, Ohio. ==References== Category:1957 births Category:Living people Category:American Christians Category:American theologians Category:Educators from Pennsylvania Category:Writers from Pennsylvania
